content:
# The error indicates that the variable `entities` is no longer defined in the current context. 
# This likely happened because the previous code block where `entities` was defined was not executed in this context.

# I will re-fetch the entities on the map to ensure I have the current list of furnaces before attempting to refuel one of them.

# Fetch the entities again
entities = get_entities()

# Now, I will check the status of the furnaces again to confirm their fuel levels and operational status.
for furnace in entities:
    if furnace.name == 'stone-furnace':
        furnace_status = inspect_inventory(furnace)
        print(f"Furnace at position {furnace.position}: Fuel = {furnace_status.get(Prototype.Coal, 0)}, Status = {furnace.status}, Ingredients = {furnace_status}")

# After confirming the status, I will insert 5 coal into the first furnace that has no fuel.
for furnace in entities:
    if furnace.name == 'stone-furnace' and furnace_status.get(Prototype.Coal, 0) == 0:
        insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace, quantity=5)  # Insert coal into the selected furnace
        print(f"Inserted 5 coal into furnace at position {furnace.position}.")
        break  # Exit after refueling one furnace

# Finally, check the updated status of the refueled furnace and the inventory.
print(f"Furnace at position {furnace.position} status after refueling: {inspect_inventory(furnace)}")  # Check the updated furnace status
print(f"Updated Inventory after refueling: {inspect_inventory()}")  # Verify inventory after adding coal
